column1: Table 24. Percent of prisoners under the jurisdiction of military correctional authorities with any sentence length, by branch of service and most serious offense, December 31, 2022
Report title: Prisoners in 2022 – Statistical Tables   NCJ 307149
Data source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, based on data from the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness, U.S. Department of Defense, 2022
Authors: E. Ann Carson, PhD, former BJS Statistician; and Rich Kluckow, DSW, BJS Statistician
Table 24. Percent of prisoners under the jurisdiction of military correctional authorities with any sentence length, by branch of service and most serious offense, December 31, 2022

Note: Percentages and counts are based on prisoners sentenced to any length of time under military correctional authority. Excludes pretrial detainees. U.S. Coast Guard offense distribution is not shown due to a small number of cases. Details may not sum to totals due to rounding.
a/Includes prisoners who served in the U.S. Coast Guard and the U.S. Space Force.
b/Includes sexual harassment and misconduct, indecent exposure, prostitution, stalking, and other nonviolent sexual offenses.
d/Includes possession, use, trafficking, and other drug offenses.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, based on data from the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Personnel and Readiness, U.S. Department of Defense, 2022.
